intro: Sloanea, commonly known as the "sloanea tree," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It comprises approximately 200 species, predominantly found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. These plants are typically evergreen shrubs or small trees, characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and showy, clustered flowers. Sloanea species often have latex-containing stems and produce fruits that are either capsules or berries. They play an important role in their ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
